stanza.line: I grant thou wert not married to my muse
And therefore mayst without attaint oerlook
The dedicated words which writers use
Of their fair subject blessing every book
Thou art as fair in knowledge as inhue
Finding thy worth a limit past mypraise
And therefore art enforced to seekanew
Some fresher stamp of the time betteringdays
And do so love yet when they have devised
Thou truly fair wert truly sympathized
In true plain words by thy true tellingfriend
And their gross painting might be betterused
Where cheeks need blood in thee it isabused
